Articles.Content: Quick, make a friend on Steam and mooch off them so they can buy you a game!

jokes please don't kill me mods
Why? Check steam...It's time. MUhAhAHAHAH!
Do you have to install steam to use the community features?
Yes. shouldn't take too long
I don't know if i want to do that

Yeah, and it turns out you need to have bought a game to use the community features... which sucks...

We need to find a way to host an open chatroom where people can make their own channels and etc. Steam works fine but you need to meet dumb requirements...
Do any of you use Kerbal life feed?
could you get one of the free games
So all you guys are on steam now?

Yeah, and it turns out you need to have bought a game to use the community features... which sucks...

We need to find a way to host an open chatroom where people can make their own channels and etc. Steam works fine but you need to meet dumb requirements...

...Make a chatroom on an IRC server? You'll need to use a chat client to access it, and someone will probably have to register the channel to make it permanent, but all that's pretty simple.

I think places like Proboards and Invisionfree still allow you to make forums for free using a basic template. At least, they did several years ago back when my best friend and I started up our own madhouse.

So all you guys are on steam now?

yep. we're waiting' for stuff to happen. If any of you would like oblige?

could you get one of the free games

Nope, doesn't work. Steam wants you to spend money with them.

So, until further notice, if I'm not on the forums and there's something urgent, either PM me or get Chobit to tell me. Good luck with that second one.

*back to the writing desk*
So without buying a game i can't take part in the community at all?

So without buying a game i can't take part in the community at all?

Yeah, it kinda sucks. I'm in the same boat. :/

You should be able to. I know that trekkette posted on one of the forums within the group. Unless that was just steam being buggy, you should be able to participate in the group forums, but not group chat.
